bn.core

Class Assignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<RandomVariable,java.lang.Object>
          • bn.core.Assignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<RandomVariable,java.lang.Object>

    public class Assignment
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap<RandomVariable,java.lang.Object>
    An Assignment is a list of RandomVariables and their corresponding values (Objects). Currently implementation uses a LinkedHashMap to get a predictable iteration ordering, which is helpful for debugging.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(RandomVariable var,
                java.lang.Object val)
        Set the value of the given RandomVariable stored in this Assignment. This method is an alias for HashMap.put(K, V).

      • variableSet

        public java.util.Set<RandomVariable> variableSet()
        Returns a Set view of the RandomVariables contained in this Assignment. The set is backed by the map.
        See Also:
        HashMap.keySet()

      • copy

        public Assignment copy()
        Returns a shallow copy of this HashMap instance: the keys and values themselves are not cloned.
        See Also:
        HashMap.clone()
